questions.question: Click on Mercury
questions.fact: This is Mercury. It is the closest planet to the sun.

questions.question: Click on Venus
questions.fact: This is Venus. It is the 2nd planet from the sun.

questions.question: Click on Earth
questions.fact: This is Earth. We are the 3rd planet from the sun.

questions.question: Click on Mars
questions.fact: This is Mars. It is the 4th planet from the sun.

questions.question: Click on Jupiter
questions.fact: This is Jupiter. It is the 5th planet from the sun.

questions.question: Click on Saturn
questions.fact: This is Saturn. It is the 6th planet from the sun.

questions.question: Click on Uranus
questions.fact: This is Uranus. It is the 7th planet from the sun.

questions.question: Click on Neptune
questions.fact: This is Neptune. It is the 8th (and furthest) planet from the sun.

questions.question: Which planet has life (that we know of)?
questions.fact: Earth is the only planet with life on it (that we know of).

questions.question: Which planets have no rings
questions.fact: Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars, and Jupiter have no visible rings.

questions.question: Which planets have rings
questions.fact: Saturn, Uranus, Neptune have rings

questions.question: Which planet has no moons?
questions.fact: Mercury and Venus have no moons.

questions.question: Which planet has no atmosphere?
questions.fact: Mercury has no atmosphere (air).

questions.question: What is the biggest planet in out solar system?
questions.fact: Jupiter is the biggest planet in our solar system.

questions.question: What is the smallest planet in out solar system?
questions.fact: Mercury is the smallest planet in our solar system.

questions.question: Which planets are gas giants?
questions.fact: Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune are known as gas giants because they are made of gas.

questions.question: Which planets have a solid surface (terrestrial)?
questions.fact: Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars have solid surfaces (they are "terrestrial").

questions.question: Which planet has a molten metal core?
questions.fact: Mercury, Earth and Mars have molten metal cores.

questions.question: Which planet is an ice giant (has an ice core)?
questions.fact: Uranus and Neptune are known as ice giants because there cores are made of ice

questions.question: Which planet spins backwards?
questions.fact: Venus and Uranus spin backwards. The sun rises in the west, and sets in the east.

questions.question: Which planet rotates sideways?
questions.fact: Uranus rotates on its side.

questions.question: What is the windiest planet?
questions.fact: Neptune is the windiest planet, where wind speeds can reach 2,000 kilometers per hour.

questions.question: Which planet gets its color from iron minerals rusting (oxidizing)?
questions.fact: Mars is red because iron mineral on the surface are rusting (oxidizing).

questions.question: Which planet has two moons called Phobos and Deimos?
questions.fact: Mars has two moons called Phobos and Deimos.

questions.question: Which planet has a red spot that is a giant storm?
questions.fact: The red spot on Jupiter is a giant storm.

questions.question: Which planet has 67 moons?
questions.fact: Juptier has 67 known moons, the most out of all the planets.

questions.question: Which planet has 62 moons?
questions.fact: Saturn has 62 moons.

questions.question: Which planet is made of mostly hydrogen and helium?
questions.fact: The gas giants (Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune) are mostly made of hydrogen and helium gas.

questions.question: Which gas planet is also made of water, ammonia and methane?
questions.fact: The ice giants (Uranus and Neptune) are mostly made of water, ammonia and methane.
